task.title: Install and set up the Flex SDK
task.shortdesc: The Desktop HLS version of the Primetime reference implementation requires Adobe Flex SDK 4.6.0.

step.cmd: Unpack the archive file to a location of your choice.
step.info: When you unpack the archive, it will create a parent directory of flex_sdk_4.6.

step.cmd: Download the playerglobal.swc, version 11.9 or later, from http://www.adobe.com/support/flashplayer/downloads.html.
step.info: The Primetime SDK libraries use classes and objects in the latest Flash Player release, so it is necessary to add the latest version of the Flash Player's playerglobal.swc to the Flex SDK. After you download the swc, do the following:

substep.cmd: If you haven't already done so, download and install the corresponding Flash Player debugger from http://www.adobe.com/support/flashplayer/downloads.html.
Create a folder in your Flex SDK's frameworks/lib/player path with the version number of the playerglobal.swc as the name.
Move the playerglobal.swc into this folder and rename the file to playerglobal.swc.

info.note: If you are using a Flash Player version that is newer than 11.9, you might need to change the target player version under the Dependencies tab of the build configuration for each project.
